title: AFLoRA: Adaptive Freezing of Low Rank Adaptation in Parameter Efficient Fine-Tuning of Large Models
abstract: arXiv:2403.13269v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: We present a novel Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT) method, dubbed as Adaptive Freezing of Low Rank Adaptation (AFLoRA). Specifically, for each pre-trained frozen weight tensor, we add a parallel path of trainable low-rank matrices, namely a down-projection and an up-projection matrix, each of which is followed by a feature transformation vector. Based on a novel freezing score, we the incrementally freeze these projection matrices during fine-tuning to reduce the computation and alleviate over-fitting. Our experimental results demonstrate that we can achieve state-of-the-art performance with an average improvement of up to $0.85\%$ as evaluated on GLUE benchmark while yeilding up to $9.5\times$ fewer average trainable parameters. While compared in terms of runtime, AFLoRA can yield up to $1.86\times$ improvement as opposed to similar PEFT alternatives. translated_title: AFLoRA: 自适应冻结低秩调整在大型模型参数高效微调中的应用
translated_abstract: 我们提出了一种新颖的参数高效微调（PEFT）方法，称为自适应冻结低秩调整（AFLoRA）。具体地，对于每个预训练的冻结权重张量，我们添加一个可训练的低秩矩阵并行路径，即下投影和上投影矩阵，每个矩阵后面跟着一个特征变换向量。基于一种新颖的冻结分数，我们在微调过程中逐步冻结这些投影矩阵，以减少计算量并减轻过拟合。我们的实验结果表明，我们可以在GLUE基准测试中获得最先进的性能，平均改善高达0.85％，同时可减少高达9.5倍的平均可训练参数。在运行时间方面，与类似的PEFT备选方案相比，AFLoRA可以提供高达1.86倍的改进。除了我们方法的实际效用之外，我们还提供了关于训练
tldr: AFLoRA是一种自适应冻结低秩调整方法，通过逐步冻结投影矩阵来提高性能，减少计算量，并提供对GLUE基准测试的最先进表现。
en_tdlr: AFLoRA is an adaptive freezing of low rank adaptation method that incrementally freezes projection matrices to improve performance, reduce computation, and achieve state-of-the-art results on the GLUE benchmark.
